channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024050307
item.description:
Report E-2024050307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTO experienced a UN1760 Extreme 184 release from (15) 5-gallon bladder boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor and a 10’ x 4’ area of the wood trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged boxes of products were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and an 85-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbents and neutralizer used to clean the release were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050321
item.description:
Report E-2024050321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN2672 Steammate NA1324 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 25' x 10' area of the concrete lot below. The release was caused by the tote falling on its side as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbent and vinegar were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents were containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024050024
item.description:
Report I-2024050024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: Willoughby
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: , Clean Harbors Environmental Services Inc. was contracted to perform the cleanup.Upon arrival on site, Clean Harbors Environmental Services Inc. met with Lake County Hazmat Team. The intermodal container was inspected, and one 55-gallon drum was detected at nose of trailer, which had tipped, resulting in the loss of approximately 1 gallon of free product. Free product was contained to container floor and asphalt beneath. Clean Harbors Environmental Services applied a neutralizer agent to the affected asphalt surface, and the free product on the container floor, which was swept up and placed into one 55-gallon drum, along with cleanup debris. The intermodal container was offloaded, damaged drum was overpacked, and container floor was cleaned. Thete were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report E-2024050190
item.description:
Report E-2024050190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2024, twelve (12) 50-pound bags of UN1487 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged bags and containerized them in four (4) 35-gallon drums. Crews then utilized a HEPA filter vacuum to collect the product from the dock floor. TLE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate any residual product. All UN1487 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050235
item.description:
Report E-2024050235

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the released material with absorbent material and containerized the spent material in one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with the two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050159
item.description:
Report E-2024050159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: Grafton
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Ross Transportation Services, Inc. (RTS)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At about 17:30, a woman called RTS stating that she was following a tanker pulled by an RTS truck on RT 83 and residual material from the tanker had splashed onto her car (a red crossover Mercedes-Benz). RTS was transporting a tanker from American Woodmark Corp. and had dropped the tanker in its transfer line. Records indicate the driver had noted a faulty seal at the top of the tanker on his post trip inspection. Investigation confirmed that the grey material that had splashed down the side of the tanker, as well as on the ground from the manhole overflow tube appeared similar to the specks splashed on the car. No material was on the roadway. The spill in the transfer line was cleaned up, and a reportable spill report filed. The citizen arrived on site to show us the material on her car, which were small droplets of grey material. The gasket/seal has been replaced.
